result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M. Zvolena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jeremy M. Zvolena in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicated that there were a couple of false statements in the PSI.  Argument by Attorney Tlusty regarding sentencing.  Statement by defendant regarding sentencing.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  22 days sentence credit.  Costs shall be paid at the rate of $200.00 a month beginning August 2, 2018.  - rt
Sentencing hearing on July 2, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M. Zvolena in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court asked DE if he reviewed Pre-sentence investigation report.  DE stated that he has not.  Court ordered a brief recess for DE to review PSI.  10:50 a.m. Court reconvened.  DE requested to adjourn sentencing in order to get his affairs in order for sentencing.  Court granted request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2018 at 01:30 pm. ba

Defendant Jeremy M. Zvolena in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea agreement put into the record.  Court discusses with defendant on how he waived his right to an attorney as he has had several attorneys in the past and he did not want any of them. Defendant enters the following plea-   16CF4 - Count 5 - Plea of no contest.  16CF60 - Count 2 - Plea of no contest.  16CF114 - Amended Information - Count 1 - Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.   Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty in 16CF4 - Count 5, 16CF60 - Count 2 and 16CF114 - Count 1.   Court dismisses and read in the remaining charges and Case No. 16CF67.   Court orders a presentence investigation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2018 at 10:15 am. - rt
Sentencing hearing on May 29, 2018 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Jeremy M. Zvolena in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty. Court stated on the record what occurred on September 20, 2017 regarding Mr. Zvolena getting an attorney for his jury trials.  Court will not be adjourning the jury trials.  Mr. Zvolena has warrants in Clark County for failure to pay.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2018 at 11:00 am. - rt

Status conference on November 30, 2017 at 04:15 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M. Zvolena in court with attorney John Charles Bachman by phone.   Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bachman filed a motion to withdraw.  Brief recess for Attorney Bachman and the defendant to talk privately.  Back on the record.  Mr. Zvolena indicated that he wants Attorney Bachman to withdraw and he will hire a private attorney.  Court advises defendant of his right to attorney and the consequences if he requests another attorney.  The court indicates to defendant that these matters will not be delayed any more, if he does not have an attorney.  Court indicates that he will waive his right to an attorney.  Court goes over with the defendant his right to an attorney.  Court grants Attorney Bachman's request to withdraw as an attorney. Attorney Bachman left the hearing.   Court orders defendant to hire an attorney by November 30, 2017.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2017 at 04:15 pm.  Defendant indicated that his address was 384 Tompkins Street, Fond du Lac, WI but he was not sure of the spelling of the street name and did not know the zip code.  Court ordered him to contact the clerk's office by tomorrow with his correct address.  - rt
Motion hearing on September 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M. Zvolena in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting that the court begin bond revocation proceedings in all of his cases.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a new bond in the amount of $1,000.00 cash on each case and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Case No. 16CF67 - no contact with D.J. D. - dob: 1-10-84.  Statement by defendant.  Per defendant - 1135 W. Broadway, Medford, WI is defendant's mailing address.  Defendant is staying at friends houses.    Court is ordering $500.00 cash bond on each case with conditions as requested by the district attorney.  Clerk to begin bond revocation proceeding.     Court address 16TR119 - forfeiture of $200.50.  Defendant can ask court to entertain modifying his request purge conditions upon posting the cash bonds.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.  - rt
Pre-trial conference on August 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Court calls cases 16CF4, 16CF67 and 16CF60.  Defendant Jeremy M. Zvolena in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed on 16CF4 - based on waiver court bound DE over for trial.  Information filed by the state.  DE waived further reading of same and entered pleas of not guilty to all charges.  Matter set for PTC. Bond continued.  On 16CF60 and 16CF67  Defendant waived further reading of complaint; preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.  PTC requested and scheduled.  The state requested on 16CF60 a signature bond in the amount of $5,000.00 with standard conditions and special conditions of: Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.  The state requested on 16CF67 a signature bond in the amount of $3,000.00 with standard conditions and special conditions of: Shall not possess or consume controlled substances without valid prescription and no contact with D.J.D.-dob: 1-10-84.   Response by DE.  Court set bonds as requested. Pre-trial conference set for July 6, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. ba
